title: The 7 MLB execs under the most pressure at the trade deadline
content: With the deadline on July 31, here are the front offices that could make or break their futures this trade season.

title: Grading the blockbuster stunner that sends Rafael Devers to the Giants
content: The Red Sox stunned the baseball world Sunday, trading their $313.5 million All-Star to San Francisco.

title: Red Sox deal All-Star Devers to Giants in stunner
content: The Giants are sending Jordan Hicks, Kyle Harrison, outfield prospect James Tibbs III and pitching prospect Jose Bello to the Red Sox for Rafael Devers.

title: Spaun captures first major title, wins U.S. Open
content: J.J. Spaun, 34, who started Sunday one stroke behind 54-hole leader Sam Burns, survived a terrible start and challenging elements to pull away from the pack and capture his first major title with a two-stroke win in the U.S. Open at Oakmont Country Club.

title: Ohtani to return to mound vs. Padres on Monday
content: Shohei Ohtani will make his long-awaited return to pitching Monday night in a matchup against the division-rival San Diego Padres.

title: Grizzlies send Bane to Magic in blockbuster trade
content: The Grizzlies traded Desmond Bane to the Magic for Kentavious Caldwell-Pope, Cole Anthony, four unprotected first-round picks and one first-round pick swap.

title: Chestnut returning to Nathan's hot dog contest
content: Joey Chestnut, competitive eating legend, announced Monday that he is returning to the Nathan's Famous Hot Dog Eating Contest after a one-year hiatus from the annual Fourth of July event.

title: USMNT ends skid, nets 5 in Gold Cup opening win
content: Malik Tillman scored twice as the United States built a three-goal, first-half lead and ended a four-game losing streak by routing Trinidad and Tobago 5-0 on Sunday in a Concacaf Gold Cup opener.

title: Sky's Reese 2nd youngest to record triple-double
content: Angel Reese had 11 points, 11 assists and 13 rebounds for her first career triple-double in the Sky's 78-66 win over the Sun on Sunday.

title: Judge 1-for-12 as NY swept: Got to swing at strikes
content: Aaron Judge blamed himself for swinging at pitches outside the strike zone as the Yankees were swept in a three-game series at the Red Sox.

title: üèÄ How Bane trade will impact NBA offseason
content: Sunday's shocking deal has ramifications far beyond Orlando and Memphis -- including the Kevin Durant trade saga.

title: Inside the 7 plays defining these back-and-forth NBA Finals
content: Through four NBA Finals games, OKC and Indiana are separated by just six total points. These plays can help uncover why.

title: How J.J. Spaun battled Oakmont, rain and bad breaks for a U.S. Open title
content: Oakmont was almost unplayable Sunday afternoon in the rain. But in the end, it was exactly what Spaun needed to become one of the unlikeliest U.S. Open champions.

title: How a bucket-list MCWS trip turned into reality for Arkansas' Bash Braddahs
content: For five months, the Aloys have been making noise in Arkansas. Now their talent and journey is on full display.

title: USMNT eases pressure with big win to open Gold Cup, but tougher tests ahead
content: Sunday's big win should relieve some pressure on a U.S. team that's been struggling for form and harmony of late. However, it's clear bigger tests are ahead at this Gold Cup and beyond.

title: Betting buzz: Ohtani pitching props, Clark's big game, impact of Devers and Bane trades
content: Caitlin Clark delivers for bettors in her return, Shohei Ohtani returns to the mound, and a longshot wins the U.S. Open.

title: Panthers within one win of a Cup repeat: Grades for both teams, outlook for Game 6
content: Florida leads Edmonton 3-2 heading home for the next game. Here's how it happened, and what to watch for.

title: Texas State, cryptic posts and the Pac-12's next move
content: Texas State looms as the favorite to join the Pac-12. Why could that happen? What would come next? And what about Memphis?

title: Are Real Madrid ready to begin the Xabi Alonso era at the Club World Cup?
content: Xabi Alonso needs to hit the ground running at Real Madrid, with the Club World Cup starting just three weeks after he was hired as coach.

title: Poch: U.S. needed win after losses, recent 'noise'
content: SAN JOSE, Calif. -- United States coach Mauricio Pochettino welcomed the positives vibes from a tournament-opening 5-0 Gold Cup win over Trinidad and Tobago at PayPal Park that snapped a recent four-game losing streak.

title: Lloris: Spurs must build on Europa League win
content: Hugo Lloris believes his former club Tottenham have lifted a weight off their shoulders after winning the Europa League, and must build on from it.

title: Delap challenged to earn No. 9 after Chelsea move
content: Enzo Maresca believes Liam Delap has the potential to become England's main striker, but warned the 22-year-old he faces a fight to get into the Chelsea line-up first.

title: Musiala nets hat trick, Bayern hit 10 to start CWC
content: Bayern Munich began their Club World Cup campaign in emphatic fashion with a ruthless 10-0 demolition of Auckland City on Sunday, as Jamal Musiala marked his return from injury with a brilliant second-half hat trick in a commanding team display.

title: PSG 'hungry' to add Club World Cup to UCL win
content: Luis Enrique said his Paris Saint-Germain team are "hungry" to add the Club World Cup to their Champions League success, after beating Atl√©tico Madrid 4-0 in the opening game in Group B.

title: Italy great Gattuso named country's new coach
content: Former midfield great Gennaro Gattuso has been appointed as Italy's new head coach following Luciano Spalletti exit from the national team.

title: Angel City wear shirts supporting 'immigrant city'
content: Angel City, the NWSL team based in Los Angeles, distributed T-shirts to fans on Saturday that proclaimed "Immigrant City Football Club."

title: The Liberty won their first WNBA title last year; here's why they're even better now
content: Their perfect season ended Saturday, but the defending champs might be better than last year, with one notable weakness.

title: Kiah Stokes, Nyara Sabally on the rise
content: Nyara Sabally and Kiah Stokes could be on the rise in fantasy leagues with increased opportunity ahead in the wake of injuries.

title: Don't be surprised if ... these 19 things happen in 2025
content: In fantasy, you don't draft last year's stats, which is why it's important to be forward-thinking. Eric Karabell offers his thoughts on players who could delight or disappoint in 2025.

title: McLaren's Montreal miscues give F1 rivals hope for rest of 2025
content: Sunday's Canadian GP was the first podium in 2025 that didn't feature a McLaren. Is the tide about to turn on F1's runaway leader?

title: Shane van Gisbergen wins Cup race at Mexico City
content: Shane van Gisbergen once again mastered a new track to win NASCAR's first Cup Series points-paying race outside the United States in the modern era.

title: Jones-Aspinall: A timeline of MMA's heavyweight melodrama
content: All the talk, social media posts, fakeouts and speculation over whether Jon Jones and Tom Aspinall will ever fight.

content: A look at Indiana's and Oklahoma City's uniform schedules for Games 1 through 6 of the 2025 NBA Finals.

content: Best clutch player? Top on-ball defender? Elite court vision? We hand out superlatives for this year's class.

title: MLS: Philly win to keep pressure on Vancouver at the top
content: Despite the Gold Cup and Club World Cup causing havoc, Philadelphia Union are eying top spot in ESPN's MLS Power Rankings.

title: NWSL: Can anyone stop Kansas City?
content: When the Current are firing on all cylinders, there's no stopping them. That and more in our latest rankings.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Barcelona to swap Ara√∫jo for Rafael Le√£o?
content: Could Barcelona sign Milan winger Rafael Leao in a direct swap with defender Ronald Araujo? Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Debunking the 'Man United tax' myth
content: Transfer chiefs have complained for years, but it's on the club to stop paying over the odds for players.

title: An 11-year NBA veteran and the emergency transplant that saved his life
content: Sixteen months ago, Scot Pollard was in active heart failure, about to die. Then came a lifesaving transplant, uniting two families -- and two fathers -- forever. Watch E60's "Heart of Pearl" at 1 p.m. ET on ESPN.

title: As Israeli Air Strikes Intensify, Iran State TV Studio Hit During Live Bulletin
content: Missiles have been raining from the skies across most of Iran, especially its capital, Tehran, as Israel has claimed "total air superiority" over the gulf nation as hostilities grow exponentially between the two arch rivals.

title: Updates: Vijay Rupani's Last Rites Performed With Full State Honours
content: Former Gujarat Chief Minister Vijay Rupani was on the Air India flight 171, belonging to Boeing Dreamliner 787-8 fleet, which crashed on Thursday afternoon within seconds after take-off.

title: Male Friend Tied Up, Woman Gang-Raped At Odisha Beach; 7 Detained
content: A young woman was allegedly gang-raped at a beach in Odisha's Ganjam district. The woman was at Gopalpur beach, a famous tourist destination in the state, along with a male friend on Sunday when she was raped by a group of men.

title: UP Man Performs Symbolic Wedding With Dead Dead Before Her Cremation
content: A man performed a symbolic wedding with his deceased fiance just hours before her funeral in Uttar Pradesh's Maharajganj district.

title: Ahmedabad Plane Crash: Families Endure Agonising Wait For Loved Ones' Remains
content: Civil Superintendent Dr Rakesh Joshi attempted to reassure the grief-stricken families, appealing for patience amidst the time-consuming process of DNA matching.

title: "We Knew It Would Collapse": Pune Bridge A Tragedy In The Making
content: The scenic village of Kundmala in Maval, Pune turned into a site of shock and mourning after a 30-year-old footbridge - built only for pedestrians - collapsed last week under the weight of thousands of tourists and half a dozen bikes that crowded ont

title: 12 Hours, 5 Flight Incidents: Aviation Safety Under Scrutiny
content: Days after the deadly Air India Dreamliner crash in Ahmedabad, five flights across the world reported emergencies within a span of 12 hours.

title: PM Modi Gifts Handmade Kashmiri Silk Carpet To Cyprus President During Visit
content: Prime Minister Narendra has gifted a handmade Kashmiri silk carpet to Cyprus President Nikos Christodoulides and a silver clutch purse crafted in Andhra Pradesh during his visit to the country.

title: 460 Sprinkler Machines With Smog Guns To Hit Delhi Streets Soon: Rekha Gupta
content: Delhi Chief Minister Rekha Gupta said on Monday that the national capital will soon be equipped with 460 sprinkler machines, 70 mechanical road sweeping machines, 70 litter picker machines, water tankers, and dust dump vehicles.

title: Love Marriage, A Kidnapping And A Senior Cop's Arrest In Tamil Nadu
content: In a dramatic development, the Madras High Court has ordered the arrest of Additional Director General of Police (ADGP) HM Jayaram in connection with an alleged kidnapping case involving a family dispute over a love marriage.

title: Denied Ambulance, Man Travels 90 Km In Bus With Newborn's Body In Carry Bag
content: Sakharam Kavar's voice trembled with deep anguish and helplessness as he recalled the 90-km agonising journey no parent should endure.

title: India To Launch $1.5 Billion Joint Earth Mission With NASA In July
content: NISAR (NASA-ISRO Synthetic Aperture Radar) is a joint Earth-observing satellite mission developed by NASA and ISRO.

title: A 113 Km-Long Canal: Inside India's Big Indus Waters Treaty Plan
content: India is conducting a feasibility study for constructing a 113 km-long canal for redirecting surplus flow from the three western rivers of the Indus water system to Punjab, Haryana and Rajasthan, top sources have told NDTV.

title: Explained: Extent Of Damage Israel Has Inflicted On Iran's Nuclear Sites
content: Israel has carried out wide-ranging military strikes on Iran, hitting sites including some of its most important nuclear facilities.

title: Anti-Terror Watchdog FATF's Rare Acknowledgement On Pahalgam Attack
content: The global terror watchdog has expressed grave concern over the April 22 Pahalgam terror attack, in which 26 people were killed.

title: Pics: Ranthambore Tigress Takes Down Crocodile In Rare Jungle Encounter
content: The incident occurred in Ranthambore Tiger Reserve when tigress T-84, known as Arrowhead, ambushed a crocodile emerging from the water.

title: "Proud Moment For India": BJP As PM Modi Receives Cyprus' Highest Civilian Honour
content: The BJP on Monday hailed Prime Minister Narendra Modi receiving Cyprus' highest civilian honour as a "proud moment for India" and said no other PM in the country's history has ever commanded such a "decisive influence" on the global stage as him.

title: Rs 5 lakh Aid Announced For Families Of Those Killed In Pune Bridge Collapse
content: Following the collapse of a bridge over the Indrayani River in Maharashtra's Pune district on Sunday afternoon, the district administration on Monday announced financial assistance of Rs 5 lakh each for the families of the four individuals who lost t

title: Iran's Supreme Leader Khamenei Faces Ultimate Test After Israeli Strikes
content: Iran's supreme leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, has weathered a series of challenges but Israel's unprecedented strikes mark his most serious crisis yet, threatening both the clerical system he leads and his own physical survival.

title: 5 Killed, 3 Critically Injured As Car, Bike Collide In UP's Mahoba: Cops
content: Five people were killed and three others critically injured when a car collided head-on with a motorcycle in Srinagar area here at around 1.30 pm on Monday, police said.

title: Watch: Anchor runs for life as Israel bombs Iran State TV; studio turns to dust
content: Tensions escalate as Israel bombs Iranian state news amid ongoing hostilities. A video shows a news presenter fleeing as an explosion rocks the studio. Despite the attack, Iran's broadcasting service resumed coverage, vowing resilience. This follows a fresh wave of Iranian missile strikes on Israel, resulting in casualties and heightened fears of a wider regional conflict.

title: Trump declares war on 'millions upon millions' illegal immigrants in US cities
content: President Trump declared war on America's largest cities, ordering mass deportations of illegal immigrants he accuses Democrats of using for electoral gain. This came after downplaying US involvement in the Israel-Iran conflict. Trump's move exacerbates divisions, pitting urban versus rural America while immigration activists decry the deportation plan as based on inflated figures and demonization.

title: Bigger Indus plan: 113km canal to take surplus to Punjab, Haryana and Rajasthan
content: India is advancing its Indus water strategy by initiating a feasibility study for a 113 km canal to transfer surplus water from Jammu & Kashmir to Punjab, Haryana, and Rajasthan. This project aims to fully utilize the eastern rivers and India's allocated share in the western rivers, potentially reducing water flow to Pakistan.

title: How China dodges the US chip ban: Flying suitcases, renting servers abroad, and ....
content: To circumvent US AI chip restrictions, Chinese firms are creatively processing data abroad, exemplified by engineers transporting hard drives to Malaysian data centers for AI model training. Southeast Asia is becoming a strategic hub with rapidly expanding data-center capacity, while the Middle East also attracts Chinese AI developers, highlighting the challenges of enforcing US export controls.

title: '5 wickets in 5 balls': Digvesh Rathi does it again; Sanjiv Goenka can't keep calm
content: Digvesh Rathi, the mystery spinner who rose to prominence with Lucknow Super Giants in IPL 2025, continues to impress. A video surfaced showing Rathi achieving a remarkable feat in a local T20 match, claiming five wickets in five balls. His impressive performance, featuring deceptive googlies, further solidifies his reputation as a talent to watch.

title: How an escalating Iran-Israel conflict can threaten India‚Äôs growth story
content: India's robust economic growth faces threats from escalating tensions in West Asia, particularly the Iran-Israel conflict, which could spike oil prices and disrupt trade routes. While India possesses sufficient energy reserves, potential disruptions could elevate inflation and shipping expenses. Government officials are closely monitoring the situation, confident that India's strong macroeconomic indicators will help it weather the crisis.

title: The Ayatollah‚Äôs gamble: Fight, fold, or fall - How far will Iran go against Israel?
content: Tensions escalate as Iran and Israel engage in direct warfare, marking a dangerous new phase after Israel's strikes on Iranian infrastructure. Iran retaliated with missile attacks on Israeli cities, resulting in casualties and widespread damage. The conflict threatens to destabilize the Middle East, disrupt global oil markets, and derail nuclear diplomacy.

title: Jobs in AI era: LinkedIn founder to Gen Z graduates; You will become 'enormously attractive' if...
content: LinkedIn co-founder Reid Hoffman encourages young people to embrace AI as a tool for job hunting, viewing them as "AI natives" who can help older professionals adapt.

title: 'Couldn't happen without money': FATF condemns Pahalgam terror attack
content: The Financial Action Task Force (FATF) has condemned the recent terror attack in Pahalgam, emphasizing the need for increased scrutiny of countries' efforts to combat terror financing. India is preparing a detailed dossier on Pakistan's alleged violations of anti-money laundering and terror financing guidelines, aiming to push for its re-inclusion in FATF's "grey list.

title: Only 4 Tests in 2025! 'Why can't Sri Lanka play as many Tests as India, Australia?' questions Mathews
content: Angelo Mathews has expressed his disappointment with Sri Lanka's limited Test schedule in the upcoming World Test Championship cycle, consisting of only six two-match series. He contrasts this with the extensive schedules of Australia, England, and India, emphasizing the importance of Test cricket for younger players.

title: Donald Trump's new smartphone: Trump T1 Mobile, its price and specifications
content: Donald Trump's family, coinciding with the 10-year anniversary of his presidential campaign launch, has launched a made in America smartphone and a carrier service. The Android smartphone, the T1 Phone is priced at $499, boasting a gold-colored design. Their flagship plan, 'The 47 Plan,' costs $47, and offers benefits like unlimited calling, text, internet and free international calling.

title: Smoke scare on Saudia Haj flight: Hydraulic leak triggers emergency at Lucknow airport
content: A Saudia aircraft arriving in Lucknow from Jeddah experienced a smoke incident in its landing gear upon arrival on Sunday. Prompt action by the Airport Rescue and Fire Fighting team and the Saudia crew ensured the safe deboarding of all passengers, primarily Haj pilgrims. A minor hydraulic oil leak in the landing gear is suspected to be the cause.

title: Sky supremacy: Why Israel owns Iran‚Äôs skies-Russia still can‚Äôt crack Ukraine‚Äôs
content: In the ongoing conflict between Israel and Iran, Israel has achieved air superiority, conducting unhindered strikes deep within Iranian territory. This dominance has allowed Israel to dismantle Iranian missile launchers and target key military leaders. The situation contrasts sharply with Russia's struggles to gain air control in Ukraine, highlighting the critical role of air power in modern warfare.

title: Wayne Gretzky caught in backlash; Trump calls him ‚Äòa free agent‚Äô; Canadians question his loyalty
content: Wayne Gretzky, a Canadian icon, faces backlash for his association with Donald Trump, particularly after Trump's remarks about Canada. Critics question Gretzky's Canadian identity, fueled by images of him at Trump events. Despite Gretzky's attempts to remain neutral, his silence on Trump's policies and his wife's social media activity have intensified the controversy, potentially impacting his legacy in Canada.

title: RIP: Mannara Chopra's father, Raman Rai Handa, passes away
content: Actress Mannara Chopra is mourning the loss of her father, Raman Rai Handa, who passed away on June 16, 2025. The Chopra family is deeply saddened by the demise of Raman Rai Handa. The funeral services will be held on June 18, 2025, in Andheri West, where family and friends will gather to pay their respects.

title: 'Kept staring at me': Woman confronts auto driver over theft attempt
content: In Bengaluru, a Rapido autorickshaw driver was caught red-handed by a passenger, Janhavi Kshatriyas, while attempting to steal money from her purse. Kshatriyas shared a video of the confrontation on social media, sparking outrage. She urged Rapido to take strict action and enhance background checks, emphasizing passenger safety after the unsettling incident during her ride.

title: 16th Census: 'Changed his mind?' Oppn on missing 'caste' word in notification
content: A controversy has emerged over the omission of the word "caste" in the gazette notification for India's 16th census. Congress leader Jairam Ramesh has questioned PM Modi's stance on caste census, citing previous opposition and demanding clarity.

title: UN nuclear agency flags possible radiological risks inside Iran's Natanz
content: Following Israeli strikes on Iran's Natanz nuclear facility, the IAEA warns of potential radiological and chemical contamination, though external radiation levels remain normal. Damage is confirmed at Natanz and Isfahan, raising global concerns, while the UN criticizes Israel's Gaza operations, citing 'horrifying' Palestinian suffering and urging immediate action to halt the violence.

title: Netanyahu claims Iran tried to assassinate Trump‚Äîis his claim true?
content: In a recent interview, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu declared that Iran had tried not once, but twice, to assassinate Donald Trump during the 2024 US presidential campaign. With the composure of a man who‚Äôs seen a few too many intelligence briefings, Netanyahu called Trump ‚Äúenemy number one‚Äù for Tehran and said the Islamic Republic had used proxies and clandestine operatives to carry out the plots.

title: Online payment: UPI transactions get faster; time reduced from 30 seconds to 10
content: UPI payments are now significantly faster, with transaction times reduced to 10-15 seconds, thanks to a directive from NPCI. This improvement aims to enhance user experience on the widely used digital payments platform.

title: Watch: Bengaluru Rapido rider slaps woman; claims she assaulted him first
content: In Bengaluru, a Rapido rider allegedly slapped a woman after she stopped the ride due to rash driving. She refused to pay. Videos show the woman hitting the driver. The rider retaliated, causing her to fall. The woman filed a complaint. The rider claims she attacked him first due to a route change. Police are investigating the incident.

title: Heavy rains in Mumbai: Red alert for Raigad; trains and flight services hit
content: The India Meteorological Department has issued a red alert for Raigad, Pune, and Satara districts, warning of extremely heavy rainfall. Mumbai is under an orange alert as persistent showers caused waterlogging and disrupted transportation. Since June 1st, rain-related incidents have tragically claimed 18 lives in Maharashtra, with 65 others injured.

title: Watch: Zomato delivery man gets surprise birthday party from customers
content: A Zomato delivery man experienced an unforgettable birthday surprise when customers greeted him with balloons, cake, and heartfelt wishes upon delivering their order. The heartwarming video capturing this act of kindness quickly went viral, with many praising the thoughtful gesture. This celebration served as a reminder of the importance of appreciating those who often go unnoticed.

title: Israel attacks Gaza aid again: 34 Palestinians killed
content: Tragedy struck Gaza as at least 34 Palestinians were killed in shootings near food distribution centres, marking the deadliest incident yet. The Gaza Humanitarian Foundation (GHF)-operated centres have become increasingly dangerous, with witnesses reporting that Israeli troops opened fire to control crowds at the Rafah site. While the Israeli military hasn't commented on Monday's deaths, they previously cited warning shots at individuals approaching military positions.

title: Beware! BCCI cracks down: New bone test rule to catch over-age players
content: The BCCI has introduced a new rule for junior cricketers in the Under-16 category, allowing a second bone test if the '+1 factor' makes them ineligible. This aims to ensure accurate age determination, preventing players from missing a season due to arithmetical calculations rather than scientific assessment.

title: Money laundering: Robert Vadra receives fresh ED summons
content: The Enforcement Directorate has issued a new summons to Robert Vadra in connection with a money laundering case involving arms consultant Sanjay Bhandari. Vadra, who previously missed a June 10 appearance due to illness, is now required to appear on June 17.

title: Board Member. Preacher. Assassin? The twisted life of Minnesota shooter
content: Boelter, who remains on the run, had been appointed multiple times to the Minnesota Workforce Development Board, a 41-member body advising the governor on job creation and economic policy. Public records confirm he served alongside Senator Hoffman and even participated in a virtual meeting with him in 2022 to discuss pandemic-era labour issues. Authorities say it is still unclear how well the two knew each other.

title: Tom Brady‚Äôs loss? Gisele B√ºndchen says she‚Äôs finally earned her happiness
content: Gisele Bundchen is in a new phase after her divorce from Tom Brady. She welcomed a baby boy with Joaquim Valente. Gisele feels content with her expanded family. She is a mother to Benjamin, Vivian, and considers Jack her bonus child. She spoke about healing from her divorce. Gisele focuses on her children and personal well-being.

title: Pune bridge story: How years of neglect and overcrowding sparked disaster
content: A tragic bridge collapse near Pune's Kund Mala claimed four lives, including a child, and injured over 50. The decades-old bridge, already deemed unsafe and closed, buckled under the weight of more than 100 people, ignoring warning signs. Investigations are underway to determine administrative lapses, while compensation has been announced for the victims' families.

title: Watch: 'One-third of Iranian regime's missile launchers dismantled', claims Israel
content: Tensions escalate as the IDF claims to have dismantled a third of Iran's missile launchers in response to uranium enrichment concerns. Iran accuses Israel of widening the conflict by targeting a key gas facility, South Pars, critical for domestic supply. Retaliatory missile barrages have resulted in casualties on both sides, raising fears of regional and global escalation.

title: Watch: Nicosia council member touches PM Modi's feet
content: During Prime Minister Narendra Modi's visit to Cyprus, Michaela Kythreoti Mhlapa, a council member of Nicosia, demonstrated her respect by touching his feet at the historic Centre of Nicosia. This area, known for its Venetian fortifications and cultural significance, served as the backdrop for the Prime Minister's welcome. The Centre represents the city's rich heritage.

title: Kashmir: Blast reported at Kupwara mosque site during demolition drive
content: An explosion in Jammu and Kashmir's Kupwara district injured three individuals, including a young boy. The incident took place during the demolition of an old mosque structure by the mosque management committee for a new construction. The injured were promptly hospitalized, with one person requiring further treatment at a specialized medical facility.

title: Middle East on edge: Iran signals strategic shift on nuclear commitments; mulls NPT exit
content: Amid escalating tensions and Israeli strikes, Iran considers withdrawing from the Nuclear Non-Proliferation Treaty (NPT). Iranian parliamentarians are drafting a bill to this effect, prompted by recent attacks and an IAEA resolution. While reiterating its peaceful nuclear intentions, Iran criticizes Israel's undeclared nuclear arsenal and non-signatory status to the NPT.

title: Watch: New video shows AI crash survivor emerging from burning wreckage
content: A newly surfaced video shows Vishwash Kumar Ramesh, the lone survivor of the devastating Air India AI 171 crash near Ahmedabad, being led away from the wreckage. The flight, carrying 242 passengers and crew, crashed shortly after takeoff on June 12, killing 241 onboard and later claiming the lives of 33 more on the ground.

title: IND vs ENG: Why Gautam Gambhir left England - A timeline of his absence and return
content: Gautam Gambhir, India's head coach, is set to rejoin the national squad on June 17 in England, just before the first Test against England. He had returned to India on June 12 due to his mother's heart attack. In his absence, assistant coaches managed the team's preparations, including an intra-squad match.

title: 'Earlier, I used to beat Indians at will': What global chess stars say about India's dominance
content: Gukesh Dommaraju's rise to world chess champion at 18 has sparked a chess revolution, validating Garry Kasparov's prediction. At the Delhi International Open, seasoned players like GM Tornike Sanikidze noted the fierce competition from India's young talents. Veteran Rani Hamid acknowledged India's significant progress in chess. India is now a dominant force, driven by ambitious young players.

title: Iran-Israel conflict impact: Basmati rice prices to drop; Iran may cut import
content: Basmati rice prices, recently elevated due to increased exports, are anticipated to decline due to potential export reductions to Iran amidst geopolitical tensions. Iran constitutes a significant importer of Indian basmati rice.

title: 'She was fidgety': Taylor Swift‚Äôs shy reaction to Travis Kelce question
content: Amidst Travis Kelce's NFL training in Florida, Taylor Swift's recent visit to a Miami children's hospital has sparked buzz. Her shy reaction when mentioning her boyfriend, Kelce, charmed fans, fueling speculation about their relationship. While enjoying quality time, including a Stanley Cup Playoffs appearance, rumors of a potential engagement are circulating, with sources suggesting they're committed to a future together.

title: 'Barak Magen': Israel uses new air defence system against Iran
content: In a first, the Israeli Navy successfully deployed its Barak Magen air defense system, intercepting Iranian drones. Eight drones were neutralized by Sa‚Äôar 6-class missile corvettes patrolling Israeli waters. This marked the operational debut of the Barak Magen and its LRAD interceptor.

title: RBI rate cut effect: SBI slashes lending rates by up to 50 bps
content: State Bank of India reduced its lending rates by 50 basis points, effective June 15, 2025, lowering RLLR to 7.75% and EBLR to 8.15%. Fixed deposit rates for amounts up to Rs 3 crore were also decreased by 25 basis points across various maturities.

title: Stranded Kashmiri students being shifted out of Iran‚Äôs capital Tehran to Qom, say parents
content: A J&K Students Association spokesperson says students of Tehran University of Medical Sciences, Islamic Azad University and Iran University of Medical Sciences were successfully relocated; an estimate suggested 600 students from Kashmir were shifted to safer locations in Qom

title: Four women killed, several injured in firecracker factory explosion in Amroha
content: Blast in Atrasi village brings down entire structure; U.P. CM directs officials to expedite relief efforts

title: Don‚Äôt depend on agents for PF services, EPFO tells members
content: It says several cybercafe operators and fintech companies are charging EPFO members large sums of money for services that are officially free

title: Indore Congress councillor booked after accused in rape cases allege role in religious conversion
content: Anwar Qadri named in FIRs following claims by two arrested men; Congress terms case a political conspiracy

title: Rains: call to extend Plus One admission by a day
content: AHSTA seeks an extension on admissions, which was to be held on Monday and Tuesday, in the wake of rain fury in the State

title: Restoration of Mullassery Canal in progress, HC told
content: The court observed that it was pleased to hear the inundation of the city had been under control over the past two days despite heavy rain

title: Union govt. urged to increase support to States for skilling initiatives
content: Kerala Minister articulates State‚Äôs commitment to advancing the national skilling agenda while calling for greater cooperative federalism and equitable central support

title: Kuki-Zo groups and MHA reach an understanding on closure of 7 camps close to Meitei areas, says govt. official¬†¬†
content: The meeting did not decide on extension of SoO pact with the groups; SoO representative says they also proposed certain plans involving the security forces

title: VSDP protests with bodies in front of bank in Thiruvananthapuram
content: They accuse the bank of pushing the couple by demanding repayment of a loan the couple had availed several years ago

title: EC to go for 100% webcasting of polling stations for closer monitoring of voting procedure
content: Bihar Assembly elections are due later this year and it will be the first state where 100% webcasting will be implemented.

title: Thrissur reels under heavy rain
content: Flooding, storm, power disruption leave coastal belt struggling. Wind uproots trees and damages power lines in several areas, resulting in prolonged power outages.

title: KMRL enters eighth year with plans for tramway, metro expansion
content: In-principle approval granted for feasibility study of proposed elevated tramway from High Court to Thevara; metro system planned for Thiruvananthapuram and Kozhikode, with Water Metro model set to expand to 21 locations nationwide

title: Formula-E Case: KTR questioned for eight hours by ACB
content: Security around Road No. 12, Banjara Hills, was heightened from early morning and the road leading to ACB office was barricaded

title: Rythu Bharosa, totalling ‚Çπ9,000 crore to reach all farmers in nine days, asserts Chief Minister¬†¬†
content: Deputy Chief Minister M Bhatti Vikramarka and all the Cabinet Ministers participate in the meeting ¬†¬†

title: Bindu dismissive of row over Swaraj‚Äôs wife‚Äôs PhD registration
content: Controversy surrounding the extension of PhD registration a deliberate misinformation campaign, she says

title: Going by Supreme Court ruling, T.N. Speaker can act on petition to disqualify O. Panneerselvam
content: However, this position is not in conformity with the 1986 Rules of the T.N. Assembly regarding disqualifications, which explicitly state that only an MLA can submit any such petition

title: Delay in Governor‚Äôs assent for Bill impedes Kerala‚Äôs private university plans
content: The legislation, necessary for launching private universities in the State, has been pending for over two months, putting academic planning at risk. Delay likely to cost the State potential investment in the higher education sector

title: Nellore Rural to develop 29 parks with ‚Çπ7 crore
content: The laying of foundation stone for works at 29 parks in the constituency will be organised between June 18 and 20, says MLA Kotamreddy Sridhar Reddy

title: Axiom-4 mission: ISRO coordinating with Axiom Space to refresh time-sensitive experimental specimens
content: ISRO has shortlisted seven microgravity research experiments proposed by Indian principal investigators from various national R&D laboratories and academic institutions which Group Captain Shukla will be conducting at the ISS

title: Job mela at CRDA Skill Hub in Thullur on June 18
content: Candidates who completed SSC, ITI, Diploma, B.Tech, any Degree, or Post Graduation, whether freshers or experienced, are eligible to attend the mela

title: District judge dies of cardiac arrest in his court chamber in Kalaburagi
content: Vishwanath V. Mugathi develops chest pain during court proceedings, goes to his chamber and collapses

title: Three missing girls from North Paravur traced to Kunnamkulam
content: The girls had reportedly left the hostel managed by the North Paravur municipality to meet their friend in Thrissur

title: Gavi grinds to a halt after standoff between workers, KFDC officials
content: Workers launch strike against redeployment to plantation duties even as several tasks remain pending at ecotourism centre. KFDC says a small section of workers who are unwilling to work in the plantations even when there are no tourists at all.

title: Kerala may soon have a butterfly sanctuary
content: The State Board for Wildlife, which is likely to meet this week, will consider a proposal from the State Forest department to rename the Aralam Wildlife Sanctuary as Aralam Butterfly Sanctuary. If approved, this would be the first sanctuary dedicated to the winged insects.

title: Vehicular underpass on NH stretch at Padalur near Perambalur to be ready next month
content: The NHAI, Perambalur district police and transport department¬†have jointly identified 14 locations as accident-prone along the national highway from Padalur to Thirumandurai

title: Defence Cyber Agency begins Cyber Suraksha training exercise
content: The 12-day workshop is for participants from nation agencies and other stakeholders in the defence domains

title: Tripura BJP holds protest near Bangladesh diplomatic mission over vandalism at Rabindranath‚Äôs ancestral home
content: BJP supporters shouted ‚ÄúBharat Mata Ki Jai‚Äù and ‚ÄúRabindranath lives in our heart‚Äù as a large contingent of security personnel stopped them at least 300 meters away from the Bangladesh Assistant High Commission in Agartala

title: Global watchdog FATF condemns Pahalgam attack, enhances focus on steps by countries to combat terror financing

title: Four arrested for duping bridegroom of ‚Çπ3.5 lakh
content: Gang pose as marriage brokers, initiate meeting with the groom‚Äôs family, and conduct wedding with a woman, who is mother of two, says police

title: Unemployment rate rises to 5.6% in May, female joblessness higher at 5.8%
content: The pace of joblessness among females was higher at 5.8% compared to 5.6% in males at the country level in May 2025.

title: Supreme Court stops Centre, IAF from releasing woman officer from service
content: Without prejudice to the rights of the parties or equity in favour of the officer, the Bench said Wing Commander Kavita Bhati shouldn‚Äôt be relieved and should be allowed to remain in service till the next hearing

title: Here are the big stories from Karnataka today

title: Rival camps offer divergent views of government as they battle it out in Nilambur¬†
content: The UDF‚Äôs ‚Äúacceptance‚Äù of the allegedly radical Islamist Jamaat-e-Islami support dominates political narrative, with open campaigning for the Nilambur bypoll concluding on Tuesday

title: NFC North roundtable: Who is the QB with the most to prove?
content: the NFC North is the only division in which all four teams have at least a 35% chance to make the playoffs, according to ESPN Analytics . the .662 win percentage was posted by a division since 2002 . all three teams were eliminated in their first game .

title: Bayern Munich's ruthless win in Club World Cup sets new FIFA record
content: Bayern Munich beat Auckland City 10-0 at the club world cup on sunday . the club is the most decorated club in germany's history . it's the same club that has won the Bundesliga 34 times and has a current player roster worth more than $1 billion .

title: Eagles' Saquon Barkley changes offseason approach as he enters his 'prime'
content: a chorus of confidants is advising him to take a more measured approach to his training . he says he's not retiring anytime soon . barkley says the majority of those days is just mobility, conditioning, doing all the things .

title: Can Calvin Pickard backstop another Cup Final rally for the Oilers?
content: goaltender Calvin Pickard has helped save Edmonton from back-breaking deficits in this NHL postseason . pickard has forged a career excelling in secondary roles, the classic blue-collar contributor exemplifying work ethic and a straightforward mentality . he's just a normal guy, says kane, who's popular in his room .

title: Shohei Ohtani to get back on the mound, Giancarlo Stanton returns this week
content: fantasy baseball buzz file aims to provide fantasy managers with the intel they need as news breaks around MLB . all seven of Monday's games are evening affairs, with the first pitch at 6:40 p.m. ET when the Miami Marlins host the Philadelphia Phillies .
